page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: From photos dating back to the early 1800's we can see Hythe was similar to Hythe today but The Marsh and the High Street were large dirt tracks and most of the traffic was horses and carts and pedestrians. Hythe has a lot of new buildings including a string of shops all owned by the company Hythe Electronics. This company is doing very well in Hythe. There are 3 cottages that were extremely run down and eventually became derelict, the eyesore of Hythe, and unless someone bought them they would have been demolished. A young couple, Mr & Mrs Shanks did buy them and do them up to save Hythe's history. There is a Victorian Pier in Hythe. It was started in 1879 and completed about 2 years later. Before the pier, a small rowing boat crossed to Southampton, but the ladies got dirty on the mud.
